intro: Rindera pubescens, commonly known as the hairy rindera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow in color. Rindera pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
